absyn

Class FormalParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • absyn.Absyn
      • absyn.FormalParameters

  • public class FormalParameters
extends Absyn
    A node of abstract syntax representing the formal parameters of a Kitten method.
    Author:
    Fausto Spoto

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FormalParameters(int pos, TypeExpression type, java.lang.String name, FormalParameters next)
      Constructs a node of abstract syntax for a sequence of the formal parameters of a method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      Yields the name of the first parameter.
      FormalParameters getNext()
      Yields the abstract syntax of the next parameters, if any.

      Yields the abstract syntax of the type of the first parameter.
      java.lang.String toDot(java.io.FileWriter where)
      Writes in the specified file a dot representation of the abstract syntax of the formal parameters of a method.

      Computes the list of semantical types of these parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FormalParameters

        public FormalParameters(int pos,
                        TypeExpression type,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        FormalParameters next)
        Constructs a node of abstract syntax for a sequence of the formal parameters of a method.
        Parameters:
        pos - the starting position in the source file of the concrete syntax represented by this abstract syntax
        type - the abstract syntax of the type of the first parameter
        name - the name of the first parameter
        next - the declaration of the next parameters, if any

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public TypeExpression getType()
        Yields the abstract syntax of the type of the first parameter.
        Returns:
        the abstract syntax of the type of the first parameter

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Yields the name of the first parameter.
        Returns:
        the name of the first parameter

      • getNext

        public FormalParameters getNext()
        Yields the abstract syntax of the next parameters, if any.
        Returns:
        the abstract syntax of the next parameters, if any

      • toDot

        public final java.lang.String toDot(java.io.FileWriter where)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Writes in the specified file a dot representation of the abstract syntax of the formal parameters of a method.
        Parameters:
        where - the file where the dot representation must be written
        Returns:
        the name used to refer to this node in the dot file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem while writing into the file

      • typeCheck

        public TypeList typeCheck()
        Computes the list of semantical types of these parameters. It type-checks the first parameter and then, recursively, next, if any.
        Returns:
        the list of semantical types of these parameteres

      • typeCheck

        public TypeChecker typeCheck(TypeChecker checker)
        Type-checks the parameters of a Kitten method. That is, it adds the parameters in the symbol table of the type-checker, with their declared type.
        Parameters:
        checker - the type-checker to be used for type-checking
        Returns:
        a type-checker derived from checker, but whose symbol table has been enriched with these parameters, bound to their respective type

      • toType

        public TypeList toType()
        Computes the list of semantical types of these parameters. It builds the semantical type of the first parameter and then, recursively, those of next. The difference with typeCheck() is that class types occurring in these parameters are not type-checked.
        Returns:
        the list of semantical types of these parameteres.
